metadata.author: Microsoft - support@microsoft.com
metadata.comments: Solution template for Google Cloud Platform Cloud Monitoring

metadata.description: Not used, but needed to pass arm-ttk test `Location-Should-Not-Be-Hardcoded`.  We instead use the `workspace-location` which is derived from the LA workspace
[concat('Region to deploy solution resources -- separate from location selection',parameters('location'))]
Workspace name for Log Analytics where Microsoft Sentinel is setup
resource group name where Microsoft Sentinel is setup
subscription id where Microsoft Sentinel is setup

properties.description: GCP_MONITOR Data Parser with template version 3.0.2

properties.query:
let GCP_MONITORING_CL_View = view () {
GCP_MONITORING_CL
| extend EventVendor = 'GCP'
| extend EventProduct = 'Cloud Monitoring'
| extend
      MetricLabelsInstanceName= column_ifexists('metric_labels_instance_name_s', ''),
      MetricType= column_ifexists('metric_type_s', ''),
      ResourceType= column_ifexists('resource_type_s', ''),
      ResourceLabelsProjectId= column_ifexists('resource_labels_project_id_s', ''),
      ResourceLabelsInstanceId= column_ifexists('resource_labels_instance_id_s', ''),
      ResourceLabelsZone= column_ifexists('resource_labels_zone_s', ''),
      MetricKind= column_ifexists('metricKind_s', ''),
      ValueType= column_ifexists('valueType_s', ''),
      IntervalStartTime= column_ifexists('interval_startTime_t', ''),
      IntervalEndTime= column_ifexists('interval_endTime_t', ''),
      ValueInt64Value= column_ifexists('value_int64Value_d', '')
};
let GCP_MONITORINGV2_CL_View = view () {
GCP_MONITORINGV2_CL
| extend EventVendor = 'GCP'
| extend EventProduct = 'Cloud Monitoring'
| extend 
      MetricType= column_ifexists('MetricType', ''),
      MetricLabelsInstanceName = column_ifexists('tostring(MetricLabels.instance_name)', ''), 
      ResourceType = column_ifexists('tostring(Resource.type)', ''), 
      ResourceLabelsProjectId = column_ifexists('tostring(Resource.labels.project_id)', ''),
      ResourceLabelsInstanceId = column_ifexists('tostring(Resource.labels.instance_id)', ''),
      ResourceLabelsZone =column_ifexists('tostring(Resource.labels.zone)', ''),
      IntervalStartTime = column_ifexists('tostring(Points.interval.startTime)', ''), 
      IntervalEndTime = column_ifexists('tostring(Points.interval.endTime)', ''),
      ValueInt64Value = column_ifexists('tostring(ValueType.int64Value)', ''),
      MetricKind= column_ifexists('MetricKind', ''),
      ValueType= column_ifexists('ValueType', '')
};
union isfuzzy=true (GCP_MONITORING_CL_View), (GCP_MONITORINGV2_CL_View)
| project MetricLabelsInstanceName, MetricType, ResourceType, ResourceLabelsProjectId, ResourceLabelsInstanceId, ResourceLabelsZone, MetricKind, ValueType, IntervalStartTime, IntervalEndTime, ValueInt64Value

let GCP_MONITORING_CL_View = view () {
GCP_MONITORING_CL
| extend EventVendor = 'GCP'
| extend EventProduct = 'Cloud Monitoring'
| extend
      MetricLabelsInstanceName= column_ifexists('metric_labels_instance_name_s', ''),
      MetricType= column_ifexists('metric_type_s', ''),
      ResourceType= column_ifexists('resource_type_s', ''),
      ResourceLabelsProjectId= column_ifexists('resource_labels_project_id_s', ''),
      ResourceLabelsInstanceId= column_ifexists('resource_labels_instance_id_s', ''),
      ResourceLabelsZone= column_ifexists('resource_labels_zone_s', ''),
      MetricKind= column_ifexists('metricKind_s', ''),
      ValueType= column_ifexists('valueType_s', ''),
      IntervalStartTime= column_ifexists('interval_startTime_t', ''),
      IntervalEndTime= column_ifexists('interval_endTime_t', ''),
      ValueInt64Value= column_ifexists('value_int64Value_d', '')
};
let GCP_MONITORINGV2_CL_View = view () {
GCP_MONITORINGV2_CL
| extend EventVendor = 'GCP'
| extend EventProduct = 'Cloud Monitoring'
| extend 
      MetricType= column_ifexists('MetricType', ''),
      MetricLabelsInstanceName = column_ifexists('tostring(MetricLabels.instance_name)', ''), 
      ResourceType = column_ifexists('tostring(Resource.type)', ''), 
      ResourceLabelsProjectId = column_ifexists('tostring(Resource.labels.project_id)', ''),
      ResourceLabelsInstanceId = column_ifexists('tostring(Resource.labels.instance_id)', ''),
      ResourceLabelsZone =column_ifexists('tostring(Resource.labels.zone)', ''),
      IntervalStartTime = column_ifexists('tostring(Points.interval.startTime)', ''), 
      IntervalEndTime = column_ifexists('tostring(Points.interval.endTime)', ''),
      ValueInt64Value = column_ifexists('tostring(ValueType.int64Value)', ''),
      MetricKind= column_ifexists('MetricKind', ''),
      ValueType= column_ifexists('ValueType', '')
};
union isfuzzy=true (GCP_MONITORING_CL_View), (GCP_MONITORINGV2_CL_View)
| project MetricLabelsInstanceName, MetricType, ResourceType, ResourceLabelsProjectId, ResourceLabelsInstanceId, ResourceLabelsZone, MetricKind, ValueType, IntervalStartTime, IntervalEndTime, ValueInt64Value

properties.displayName: Google Cloud Platform Cloud Monitoring (via Codeless Connector Framework) (Preview)

connectorUiConfig.title: Google Cloud Platform Cloud Monitoring (via Codeless Connector Framework) (Preview)
connectorUiConfig.descriptionMarkdown: The Google Cloud Platform Cloud Monitoring data connector ingests Monitoring logs from Google Cloud into Microsoft Sentinel using the Google Cloud Monitoring API. Refer to [Cloud Monitoring API](https://cloud.google.com/monitoring/api/v3) documentation for more details.

graphQueries.legend: Google Cloud Platform Cloud Monitoring Events

sampleQueries.description: Get a sample of Google Cloud Platform Cloud Monitoring logs

dataTypes.name: {{graphQueriesTableName}}

resourceProvider.permissionsDisplayText: Read and Write permissions are required.

instructionSteps.title: Connect Google Cloud Platform Cloud Monitoring to Microsoft Sentinel

parameters.content:
#### 1. Setup GCP Monitoring Integration
 To fetch logs from GCP Cloud Monitoring to Sentinel **Project ID** of Google cloud is required.

#### 2. Chose the **Metric Type**
 To collect logs from Google Cloud Monitoring provide the required Metric type.

For more details, refer to [Google Cloud Metrics](https://cloud.google.com/monitoring/api/metrics_gcp).

#### 3. OAuth Credentials
 To Fetch Oauth client id and client secret refer to this [documentation](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/master/Solutions/Google%20Cloud%20Platform%20Cloud%20Monitoring/Data%20Connectors/Readme.md).

#### 4. Connect to Sentinel
 Click on **Connect** to start pulling monitoring logs from Google Cloud into Microsoft Sentinel.

parameters.label: GCP Project ID
parameters.name: projectid
parameters.description: Enter your Google Cloud Project ID.

parameters.label: Metric Type
parameters.name: metrictype
parameters.description: Provide the metric types you want to collect logs for with comma separated.For example: compute.googleapis.com/instance/disk/write_bytes_count,compute.googleapis.com/instance/uptime_total

connectorDefinitionName.defaultValue: Google Cloud Platform Cloud Monitoring (via Codeless Connector Framework) (Preview)

properties.description: Google Cloud Platform Cloud Monitoring data connector with template version 3.0.2

connectorUiConfig.title: [DEPRECATED] Google Cloud Platform Cloud Monitoring (using Azure Functions)
connectorUiConfig.descriptionMarkdown:
The Google Cloud Platform Cloud Monitoring data connector provides the capability to ingest [GCP Monitoring metrics](https://cloud.google.com/monitoring/api/metrics_gcp) into Microsoft Sentinel using the GCP Monitoring API. Refer to [GCP Monitoring API documentation](https://cloud.google.com/monitoring/api/v3) for more information.

NOTE: This data connector has been deprecated, consider moving to the CCF data connector available in the solution which replaces ingestion via the deprecated HTTP Data Collector API.
connectorUiConfig.additionalRequirementBanner: >This data connector depends on a parser based on a Kusto Function to work as expected [**GCP_MONITORING**](https://aka.ms/sentinel-GCPMonitorDataConnector-parser) which is deployed with the Microsoft Sentinel Solution.

dataTypes.name: GCP_MONITORING_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
GCP_MONITORING_CL
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

value:
GCP_MONITORING_CL
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(1d)

resourceProvider.permissionsDisplayText: read and write permissions on the workspace are required.

read permissions to shared keys for the workspace are required. [See the documentation to learn more about workspace keys](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/platform/agent-windows#obtain-workspace-id-and-key).

customs.name: Microsoft.Web/sites permissions
customs.description: Read and write permissions to Azure Functions to create a Function App is required. [See the documentation to learn more about Azure Functions](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-functions/).

customs.name: GCP service account
customs.description: GCP service account with permissions to read Cloud Monitoring metrics is required for GCP Monitoring API (required *Monitoring Viewer* role). Also json file with service account key is required. See the documentation to learn more about [creating service account](https://cloud.google.com/iam/docs/creating-managing-service-accounts) and [creating service account key](https://cloud.google.com/iam/docs/creating-managing-service-account-keys).

instructionSteps.description: >**NOTE:** This connector uses Azure Functions to connect to the GCP API to pull logs into Microsoft Sentinel. This might result in additional data ingestion costs. Check the [Azure Functions pricing page](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/functions/) for details.

>**(Optional Step)** Securely store workspace and API authorization key(s) or token(s) in Azure Key Vault. Azure Key Vault provides a secure mechanism to store and retrieve key values. [Follow these instructions](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/app-service/app-service-key-vault-references) to use Azure Key Vault with an Azure Function App.

>**NOTE:** This data connector depends on a parser based on a Kusto Function to work as expected [**GCP_MONITORING**](https://aka.ms/sentinel-GCPMonitorDataConnector-parser) which is deployed with the Microsoft Sentinel Solution.

**STEP 1 - Configuring GCP and obtaining credentials**

1. [Create service account](https://cloud.google.com/iam/docs/creating-managing-service-accounts) with Monitoring Viewer role and [get service account key json file](https://cloud.google.com/iam/docs/creating-managing-service-account-keys).

2. Prepare the list of GCP projects to get metrics from. [Learn more about GCP projects](https://cloud.google.com/resource-manager/docs/cloud-platform-resource-hierarchy).

3. Prepare the list of [GCP metric types](https://cloud.google.com/monitoring/api/metrics_gcp)

**STEP 2 - Choose ONE from the following two deployment options to deploy the connector and the associated Azure Function**

>**IMPORTANT:** Before deploying the data connector, have the Workspace ID and Workspace Primary Key (can be copied from the following), as well as Azure Blob Storage connection string and container name, readily available.

Use this method for automated deployment of the data connector using an ARM Template.

1. Click the **Deploy to Azure** button below. 

	[![Deploy To Azure](https://aka.ms/deploytoazurebutton)](https://aka.ms/sentinel-GCPMonitorDataConnector-azuredeploy)
2. Select the preferred **Subscription**, **Resource Group** and **Location**. 
3. Enter the **Google Cloud Platform Project Id List**, **Google Cloud Platform Metric Types List**, **Google Cloud Platform Credentials File Content**, **Microsoft Sentinel Workspace Id**, **Microsoft Sentinel Shared Key**
4. Mark the checkbox labeled **I agree to the terms and conditions stated above**.
5. Click **Purchase** to deploy.
instructionSteps.title: Option 1 - Azure Resource Manager (ARM) Template

instructionSteps.description: Use the following step-by-step instructions to deploy the data connector manually with Azure Functions (Deployment via Visual Studio Code).
instructionSteps.title: Option 2 - Manual Deployment of Azure Functions

instructionSteps.description:
**1. Deploy a Function App**

> **NOTE:** You will need to [prepare VS code](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-functions/create-first-function-vs-code-python) for Azure function development.

1. Download the [Azure Function App](https://aka.ms/sentinel-GCPMonitorDataConnector-functionapp) file. Extract archive to your local development computer.
2. Start VS Code. Choose File in the main menu and select Open Folder.
3. Select the top level folder from extracted files.
4. Choose the Azure icon in the Activity bar, then in the **Azure: Functions** area, choose the **Deploy to function app** button.
If you aren't already signed in, choose the Azure icon in the Activity bar, then in the **Azure: Functions** area, choose **Sign in to Azure**
If you're already signed in, go to the next step.
5. Provide the following information at the prompts:

	a. **Select folder:** Choose a folder from your workspace or browse to one that contains your function app.

	b. **Select Subscription:** Choose the subscription to use.

	c. Select **Create new Function App in Azure** (Don't choose the Advanced option)

	d. **Enter a globally unique name for the function app:** Type a name that is valid in a URL path. The name you type is validated to make sure that it's unique in Azure Functions.

	e. **Select a runtime:** Choose Python 3.11.

	f. Select a location for new resources. For better performance and lower costs choose the same [region](https://azure.microsoft.com/regions/) where Microsoft Sentinel is located.

6. Deployment will begin. A notification is displayed after your function app is created and the deployment package is applied.
7. Go to Azure Portal for the Function App configuration.

**2. Configure the Function App**

1. In the Function App, select the Function App Name and select **Configuration**.
2. In the **Application settings** tab, select **+ New application setting**.
3. Add each of the following application settings individually, with their respective string values (case-sensitive): 
		GCP_PROJECT_ID
		GCP_METRICS
		GCP_CREDENTIALS_FILE_CONTENT
		WORKSPACE_ID
		SHARED_KEY
		logAnalyticsUri (Optional)
 - Use logAnalyticsUri to override the log analytics API endpoint for dedicated cloud. For example, for public cloud, leave the value empty; for Azure GovUS cloud environment, specify the value in the following format: `https://WORKSPACE_ID.ods.opinsights.azure.us`. 
4. Once all application settings have been entered, click **Save**.

connectorUiConfig.additionalRequirementBanner: >This data connector depends on a parser based on a Kusto Function to work as expected [**GCP_MONITORING**](https://aka.ms/sentinel-GCPMonitorDataConnector-parser) which is deployed with the Microsoft Sentinel Solution.

properties.descriptionHtml:
Note: Please refer to the following before installing the solution:

Review the solution Release Notes

There may be known issues pertaining to this Solution, please refer to them before installing.

The Google Cloud Platform Cloud Monitoring data connector provides the capability to ingest GCP Monitoring metrics into Microsoft Sentinel using the GCP Monitoring API. Refer to GCP Monitoring API documentation for more information.

Underlying Microsoft Technologies used:

This solution takes a dependency on the following technologies, and some of these dependencies either may be in Preview state or might result in additional ingestion or operational costs:

  1. Log Ingestion API in Azure Monitor

  2. Microsoft Sentinel Codeless Connector Framework

NOTE: Microsoft recommends installation of "GCPMonitorCCPDefinition" (via Codeless Connector Framework). This connector is build on the Codeless Connector Framework (CCF), which uses the Log Ingestion API, which replaces ingestion via the deprecated HTTP Data Collector API. CCF-based data connectors also support Data Collection Rules (DCRs) offering transformations and enrichment.

Important: While the updated connector(s) can coexist with their legacy versions, running them together will result in duplicated data ingestion. You can disable the older versions of these connectors to avoid duplication of data..

Data Connectors: 2, Parsers: 1

Learn more about Microsoft Sentinel | Learn more about Solutions
